definition: to have one's hair stand on end (idiom)/to feel one's blood run cold

hair/feather/down/wool/mildew/mold/coarse or semifinished/young/raw/careless/unthinking/nervous/scared/(of currency) to devalue or depreciate/classifier for Chinese fractional monetary unit ( = 角[jiao3] , = one-tenth of a yuan or 10 fen 分[fen1])

sentences.english: Have you ever seen the Thriller image when he was made up?
sentences.chinese: 你以前见过他在歌曲毛骨悚然中塑造的形象吗？
这是个令人毛骨悚然的地方。

sentences.english: In the pilot, we are introduced to Felicity's creepy roommate.
sentences.chinese: 先锋队中介绍了费的令人毛骨悚然的室友。

sentences.english: The sight of the dead man made his hair stand on end.
sentences.chinese: 看到死人吓得他毛骨悚然。
这是一部令人毛骨悚然的电影。

sentences.english: After this gruesome tale the easing of the siege comes as an anticlimax.
sentences.chinese: 在这令人毛骨悚然的故事之后，保卫战形势突然好转。

sentences.english: As soon as you get them, you get loads of creepy guys.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你得到她们，你就得到许多令人毛骨悚然的家伙。
我喜欢读使人毛骨悚然的小说。

sentences.english: The tiger in the cage gave a thrilling cry.
sentences.chinese: 笼子里的老虎发出了令人毛骨悚然的吼声。

sentences.english: Stop saying that, you're giving me the willies .
sentences.chinese: 不要再说了，你让我毛骨悚然。

sentences.english: "I never say things like 'this feels spooky,"' said Crowley.
sentences.chinese: “我从来不说“感觉毛骨悚然”的，”克鲁利说。
听上去挺毛骨悚然的，但这的确是事实。

sentences.english: Being chased by a mugger is a hair-raising experience.
sentences.chinese: 被强盗追赶真是让人毛骨悚然的经历。

sentences.english: David is a timid boy. The ghost story makes his hair stand on end.
sentences.chinese: 大卫很胆小，一个鬼故事便把他吓得毛骨悚然。

sentences.english: The piercing scream curdled her blood.
sentences.chinese: 那刺耳的尖叫把她吓得毛骨悚然。

definition: shiver all over though not cold/tremble with fear/shudder
see 心驚膽戰|心惊胆战[xin1 jing1 dan3 zhan4]
lit. heart alarmed, body leaping (idiom); fear and trepidation in the face of disaster
to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
lit. heart alarmed, trembling in fear (idiom); prostrate with fear/scared witless
